snippet: The clashes that erupted Saturday night after the Supreme Court ruled that Uhuru Kenyatta was legitimately elected president were nowhere near as chaotic as the 2007 disputed election.
abstract: Protests and clashes in Nairobi, Kenya, erupt after Supreme Court rules that Uhuru Kenyatta was legitimately elected president; spurts of violence are nowhere near as chaotic, however, as 2007 disputed election.
lead_paragraph: The clashes that erupted Saturday night after the Supreme Court ruled that Uhuru Kenyatta was legitimately elected president were nowhere near as chaotic as the 2007 disputed election.

headline.seo: Kenya Sees Some Violence After Vote Is Upheld
headline.main: Spurts of Violence Punctuate Calm After Kenyan Vote Is Upheld
headline.print_headline: Spurts of Violence Punctuate Calm After Kenyan Vote Is Upheld
